intro: Chorizanthe rosea, commonly known as the pink choris, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, showy pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Chorizanthe rosea is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
